member.name: CREDENTIAL_PROVIDER_FIELD_TYPE
member.summary: Specifies a type of credential field. Used by .

member.name: CREDENTIAL_PROVIDER_FIELD_TYPE.CPFT_INVALID
member.summary: The value is invalid. This is a safe initialization value, as fields do not default to any given type.

member.name: CREDENTIAL_PROVIDER_FIELD_TYPE.CPFT_LARGE_TEXT
member.summary: A stand-alone text label is drawn in the larger of two font sizes.

member.name: CREDENTIAL_PROVIDER_FIELD_TYPE.CPFT_SMALL_TEXT
member.summary: A stand-alone text label is drawn in the smaller of two font sizes.

member.name: CREDENTIAL_PROVIDER_FIELD_TYPE.CPFT_COMMAND_LINK
member.summary: An uneditable string that a user may click to perform an action. The credential provider is informed of the user's click, and then performs the requested action. Use in your credential provider to respond to the click.

member.name: CREDENTIAL_PROVIDER_FIELD_TYPE.CPFT_EDIT_TEXT
member.summary: An edit box. Users may provide credential information by typing in this box.

member.name: CREDENTIAL_PROVIDER_FIELD_TYPE.CPFT_PASSWORD_TEXT
member.summary: A special edit control that displays its string as a series of password characters, such as the asterisk character (*). Otherwise this functions the same as CPFT_EDIT_TEXT.

member.name: CREDENTIAL_PROVIDER_FIELD_TYPE.CPFT_TILE_IMAGE
member.summary: A bitmap that is shown as the user tile image. This bitmap cannot be edited. All credential providers must contain no more than one CPFT_TILE_IMAGE. If no image is specified, Logon UI and Credential UI will supply a default tile image.

member.name: CREDENTIAL_PROVIDER_FIELD_TYPE.CPFT_CHECKBOX
member.summary: A checkbox control that allows for checked and unchecked states.

member.name: CREDENTIAL_PROVIDER_FIELD_TYPE.CPFT_COMBOBOX
member.summary: A combobox control that allows users to select an option from a defined set of choices.

member.name: CREDENTIAL_PROVIDER_FIELD_TYPE.CPFT_SUBMIT_BUTTON
member.summary: This field appears as a button on the credential tile. Pressing the button lets the user submit their credentials. There is exactly one CPFT_SUBMIT_BUTTON on any credential tile. Unlike Logon UI, which draws a special submit button in the tile layout, Credential UI hides this field and renders a single submit button for all credentials.
